0.sent: Tara stood stock-still, waiting for the first tiny gleam from the scout craft to appear in the darkness of the wormhole.

1.sent: The gentle constant breeze of recycled air from the vent above blew an annoying hair against her nose, but she ignored it.

2.sent: A gasp from the psychic broke her silent vigil, and she turned.

4.sent: she suppressed the surge of annoyance that ran through her as she contemplated the psi's gift of getting all the hot news first.

5.sent: Harmon's face slowly animated - joy sweeping in to replace stern concentration.

6.sent: "Tarrin says the planet's a freaking gemstone!

7.sent: Thriving with life, large and small forms, no buildings of any kind, hydrocarbons, metals, and a stable atmosphere.

8.sent: He's not even bringing them back through for a face to face briefing.

9.sent: He says we should come through now, immediately, before the probe is reported late."

10.sent: "Harmon, tell that good for nothing son of a beta to get his hindquarters through the gate and back here NOW, or I'll open fire on him when we come back through."

13.sent: Tarrin, no doubt with orders from Mason, was questioning her command decisions.

14.sent: That's what I get for not using mercenaries.

15.sent: She returned to her watch, regarding her own reflection in the long window.

16.sent: Mahogany-black curly hair, cut short in the typical military style framed a careworn, dark-skinned face.

17.sent: It was not an attractive face right now; her ebony eyes shadowed by hours on the watch, full lips pursed with frustration.

18.sent: She had the look of every leader she had ever known.

19.sent: At six foot two, she stood a full head taller than even her Arrallin first officer.

20.sent: Her glowering expression completed the imposing effect.

21.sent: She picked imaginary flecks off her stark gray jumpsuit, and snorted.

24.sent: Don't let fatigue get to you.

25.sent: She used the discretion of the mirrored window to secretively survey her crew.

26.sent: Harmon was an excellent addition to the bridge team, but was she open minded enough to defy United Earth Command and sever all ties from Earth?

27.sent: She watched the psi bob her head, unaware of the rest of the bridge, shaking blonde curls as she chattered away with the approaching psi relay on Mason's ship.

28.sent: She seemed so depthless - self conscious and shallow on the outside, but having that incredible gift.

29.sent: There had to be more to her.

30.sent: Well, if she didn't pan out, she'd be terminated.

31.sent: Any crew member that would jeopardize the project was meat.

32.sent: It would be a shame to lose that talent, though.

33.sent: Rakal, her first officer, was staring pensively at his panel.

34.sent: He was what this was all about.

35.sent: She watched his graceful fingers ending in thick black claws tap out calculations on the panel.

36.sent: His pointed ears swiveled back and forth, catching every sound from the bridge, while his long tail swished to the rhythm of his thoughts.

37.sent: Only those of the Arrallin Insurrection inner team knew he was no common 'beta furry'.

38.sent: His silken fur, which would be tawny golden and striped with jet black bands, was dyed perfectly to a pure black, and his mane trimmed and thinned as to be indistinguishable from the rest of his coat.

39.sent: His eyes had been treated and darkened to a rich purple to disguise the brilliant golden yellow color that would mark him as an Alpha Arrallin, and leader of his hive.

40.sent: Right now, he looked like an overgrown wolf who'd learned touch-typing.

41.sent: The scout ship re-emerged from the hole - a brilliant speck emerging from a sphere of velvety blackness.

42.sent: It's hail crackled across the comm, and Tara spun to retake her seat at the helm.

44.sent: Won't Central be crushed to learn that another gateway has yielded little more than a class F planet and a white dwarf system.

45.sent: Level 1 and 2 staffers should prepare to be briefed and move out.

46.sent: This sounds like it's the one."

47.sent: The distinctive whuffle of pleasure rippled through the betas on the bridge, and Rakal let loose a small growl, as if to caution his charges against false hope.

48.sent: They'd scouted twenty-seven gates so far, and none had turned up anything worth the Insurrection's time.

49.sent: Tara would not let giddy hopes drag them onto a rock that would spell the end for the project, and the Arrallin species.
